definition: endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: It is located in the beautiful Liuxi River bank, next to the busy 105 federal highways.
sentences.chinese: 她位于美丽的流溪河畔，依傍车水马龙的105国道。

sentences.english: She running in the car streams, searching and searching.
sentences.chinese: 她在车水马龙中，寻寻觅觅。

sentences.english: People and cars go back and forth in the busy streets, calm as the reality.
sentences.chinese: 街道上人来人往，车水马龙，现实就是这样的平静。

sentences.english: Traffic cars, cell phone calls, top video screams at me.
sentences.chinese: 车水马龙，电话嘤嗡，高端影视等伴我周围。

sentences.english: Slowing down I walk in this bustling street, heavy traffic.
sentences.chinese: 我放慢脚步，走在这车水马龙繁华街区。

definition: the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
early evening when lanterns are first lit
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
